business.headline: ED arrests ex-Reliance Communication chief Punit Garg in Rs 40,000-crore fraud casePunit Garg served as President handling the company's Global Enterprise Business between 2006 and 2013, and later as President (Regulatory Affairs) from 2014 to 2017.

NSE IPO finally approved after 9 years: Here's all you need to knowWith Sebi's clearance in hand, NSE can now formally appoint merchant bankers and legal advisers to prepare its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP). Market estimates suggest the exchange could take around eight to nine months to launch the IPO.

Will Budget 2026 bring income tax relief? What salaried taxpayers can expectAhead of Budget 2026, one question dominates conversations among salaried taxpayers: will income tax relief finally come? Let's have a look.

From AI skilling to real jobs: What industry wants from Budget 2026India has no shortage of AI talent, but turning skills into sustainable jobs remains a challenge. Ahead of Budget 2026, industry leaders want policies that connect training, infrastructure and real-world deployment.
Sensex, Nifty pause winning rally as investors turn cautious ahead of BudgetThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 296.59 points lower at 82,269.78, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 98.25 points to end at 25,320.65.

8th Pay Commission: Will employees get arrears, and if yes, when?With January 2026 nearly over and no formal announcement yet, government employees are growing anxious about the 8th Pay Commission. The big question now is whether delayed salary revisions will lead to arrears, and when the money may actually reach their bank accounts.

Budget 2026: Building India's next-generation supply chainsContinued public investment in infrastructure remains the single most important driver of logistics efficiency. Budget 2026 presents an opportunity to further strengthen this momentum by deepening last-mile connectivity to industrial clusters, agri-production zones, and Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities.

Silver prices slide after hitting record highs. Is it the right time to buy?Silver has finally cooled after a record-breaking rally. With prices stabilising and demand still strong, the real question is simple: will you use this dip to start buying?

Gold, silver ETFs tumble after record highs: Buy the dip or stay cautious?After a strong rally that pushed gold and silver to record levels, ETFs tracking the precious metals saw a steep fall on January 30. The sharp correction has sparked fresh questions about whether the dip is worth buying or if volatility may deepen further.

Budget 2026 should be an exporter's budget. Here's whyFrom tariff pressure to compliance hurdles, exporters are under strain. Budget 2026 needs to focus on easing these burdens so Indian businesses can protect market share and grow confidently this year.

Hindustan Copper, Vedanta, Hindalco fall up to 10%: Why are metal stocks down?The Nifty Metal index slipped close to 5% to 11,855.85, ending its three-day winning run during which it had gained nearly 9%. On Friday, the metal index emerged as the worst-performing sector on Dalal Street.

Budget 2026: What the agriculture sector wants from the governmentIndustry leaders say this budget needs to prioritise technology, climate resilience, credit flow, value-added production and better supply-chain systems to unlock the sector's full potential.
Gold, silver prices fall: Should you buy now or wait?If the sudden drop in gold and silver prices has caught your eye, it's worth knowing what's driving the mood right now.

Budget 2026 jitters on Dalal Street: Why stock market is under pressureMost global markets have been under pressure this week, especially technology-heavy indices, and the impact has spilled over into emerging markets like India.

Budget 2026: What the insurance sector expect from Nirmala SitharamanBudget 2026: A day ahead of the Union Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the Economic Survey 2025–26 in Parliament, outlining the government's assessment of the economy.

Rupee hits lifetime low of Rs 92 against US dollar: Should you be worried?The rupee's weakness comes at a time when global uncertainty remains high and foreign capital flows into emerging markets have slowed

Sensex falls 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayAt around 9:30 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 516.43 points at 82,049.94. The NSE Nifty50 fell 192.75 points to 25,226.15. Market participants appeared to be booking profits and reducing risk as Budget Day approached.

Sensex, Nifty open in red as metal and IT stocks drag indices ahead of BudgetThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 491.22 points to 82,075.15, while the NSE Nifty50 tanked 163.95 points to 25,254.95 as of 9:25 am.

From reforms, jobs to resilience: CEA's key messages before Budget 2026As policymakers finalise the Union Budget 2026, CEA V Anantha Nageswaran has shared key insights on how reforms, employment growth and economic resilience can keep India on a steady path.

Why is the Economic Survey talking about junk food, social media restrictions?An economic survey is mostly about GDP growth and projections. So, why did the Economic Survey 2025-26 talk about rising junk food consumption, obesity and excessive screen time? Citing government data, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran explained how poor physical and mental health among adolescents and working-age adults could weaken productivity and hurt India's long-term economic prospects.

entertainment.headline: Fiesty and strong: SRK shares note for Rani Mukerji as Mardaani 3 hits theatres Mardaani 3 released in theatres today with Rani Mukerji returning as cop Shivani Shivaji Roy. Ahead of the release, Shah Rukh Khan wished the actor and praised her performance in a heartfelt message.
Kalpana Iyer recreates iconic Ramba Ho Ho Ho at family wedding, video goes viral Kalpana Iyer recreated her iconic Ramba Ho Ho Ho dance at a family wedding, sending fans into a wave of nostalgia.

Mayasabha review: Jaaved Jafferi anchors a tale of illusion and deceptionRelease Date:Thu Jan 30, 2025 Mayasabha: The Hall of Illusion comes from Rahi Anil Barve, the acclaimed director of Tumbbad, and stars Jaaved Jafferi as a fallen producer trapped by obsession. The film released in theatres on January 30 and also features Mohammad Samad, Veena Jamkar and Deepak Damle.

Why Dhurandhar is shorter on Netflix than in theatres: Explained The Netflix version of Dhurandhar is slightly shorter than the theatrical release due to producer-led edits. Streaming platforms only distribute the version provided to them.

Remember Mohra actor Poonam Jhawer? Here's what she is doing now After her unforgettable Na Kajre Ki Dhaar appearance in Mohra, Poonam Jhawer was seen in films like Oh My God! and R...Rajkumar. In an exclusive chat with us, the actor opened up about her journey and the highs and lows of Bollywood.

The Wrecking Crew: Jason Momoa and Dave Bautista's film is pure action chaos Jason Momoa and Dave Bautista headline a loud, chaotic throwback action film that prioritises fun over logic. Read to find out if The Wrecking Crew is worth a watch.

Medha Rana talks about working with Varun Dhawan on Border 2: Sweet and supportive As Border 2 continues its steady box office run, actor Medha Rana opened up about her emotional casting journey and her experience working with Varun Dhawan.

Gaurav Khanna's wife Akansha Chamola quashes divorce rumours Bigg Boss 19 winner Gaurav Khanna's wife, Akanksha Chamola, has responded to recent rumours regarding their marriage, asserting that there is no trouble between the couple.

Priyadarshan: Defining the hera pheri of Bollywood comedy, circa 2000 On Priyadarshan's birthday, a look at the director's contribution to Bollywood comedy and his simple, story-driven style of filmmaking.

Valathu Vashathe Kallan review: Jeethu Joseph's thriller underwhelms with twistsRelease Date:Fri Jan 30, 2026 Valathu Vashathe Kallan movie review: Director Jeethu Joseph's Valathu Vashathe Kallan, starring Biju Menon and Joju George, is a thriller that revolves around a missing girl. While the film is filled with twists, it hardly lands.

SS Rajamouli announces Varanasi's meteoric arrival next year, confirms release date SS Rajamouli announces the release date of Varanasi on social media. The director is ready for the grand arrival of his epic starring Priyanka Chopra Jonas and Mahesh Babu.

Send Help review: Rachel McAdams anchors this survival thriller with wit and gritRelease Date:Fri Jan 30, 2026 Send Help is a survival thriller that places Rachel McAdams and Dylan O'Brien in a tense, often darkly funny battle against nature and each other. Directed by Sam Raimi, the film uses survival to explore power, entitlement and quiet personal transformation.

Frieren: Beyond Journey's End Season 2 is a quiet, devastating triumph Frieren: Beyond Journey's End Season 2 deepens its quiet exploration of time, grief and memory with patient, emotionally rich storytelling.

Rani Mukerji hits back at Rahman's remark: Bollywood is the most secular place Oscar-winning composer AR Rahman's comments about alleged communal bias in Bollywood have prompted a public response from Rani Mukerji. She cleared that the industry operates without discrimination and is secular in nature.

Sara Arjun shares her parents' reaction after Dhurandhar, calls it euphoric moment Sara Arjun shared that the release of Dhurandhar became the most emotional moment of her career, as her parents were moved to tears by her performance.

Kim Seon-ho reclaims romance crown with gentle charm in Can This Love Be Translated Kim Seon-ho returns to the spotlight with Can This Love Be Translated? after a temporary break. In this week's K-Fix, we look at how his comeback redefines romance with kindness and emotional depth.

Om Shanti Shanti Shantihi review: Tharun Bhascker film is same-same but differentRelease Date:Fri Jan 30, 2026 The Telugu remake of the Malayalam hit Jaya Jaya Jaya Hey, Om Shanti Shanti Shantihi works in moments but falls short of offering a distinct voice.

Louis Tomlinson Exclusive: How Did I Get Here?, handling pressure, self-love, One Direction, India English singer-songwriter Louis Tomlinson speaks to India Today's Bhavna Agarwal about his musical evolution and his latest album How Did I Get Here?. Reflecting on his journey from One Direction to a confident solo artist, Tomlinson discusses the emotional depth of his new tracks, including 'Sunflowers' and 'Sanity'.

general news.headline: Ageless Djokovic does the unthinkable, outlasts Sinner to keep No. 25 dream aliveNovak Djokovic refused to bow to time, form or expectation on Friday night, delivering one of the most stirring wins of his career by defeating defending champion Jannik Sinner to reach an 11th Australian Open final and keep his dream of a record-breaking 25th Grand Slam title alive.

Sunetra Pawar, wife of Ajit Pawar, to take oath as Maharashtra Deputy CM tomorrowSunetra Pawar will take oath as Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra on Saturday at 5 pm. Sunetra will hold the Excise and Sports portfolios, as per sources

Europe will drink Assam's tea: Amit Shah uses India-EU FTA as poll plankUnion Home Minister Amit Shah, speaking at a rally in Dibrugarh, said that Assam's tea will be poured into every European cup after the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) with the European Union. The deal would bring zero tariffs on tea leaves, Shah said. Here's how the FTA has emerged as a key poll plank in the election-bound state.

Does Trump look to India for inspiration? His $1000 scheme hints soDoes President Trump look towards India's ideas and schemes for inspiration? The US started a $1,000 scheme for newborns. Five Indian states have such a scheme, with Tamil Nadu starting it in the 90s. Not just that, Trump's ideas of MAGA and being "God's chosen one" also seem to be from PM Modi's book.

UGC equity rules: The die is casteThe kerfuffle over UGC's equity rules has settled down. But, the caste debate once again risks sliding into high-minded discourse and slippery-slope arguments that deliver little real change.

T20 World Cup: Why Pakistan will tuck its tail and travel to Sri LankaPakistan have reportedly threatened to pull out of the T20 World Cup to show solidarity with Bangladesh. But it is highly unlikely that they will ever stick to that. Here's why.

Lachit's Muslim aide didn't fight Mughals: Himanta orders rewriting of history booksAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said the state will rewrite high school history textbooks, questioning the portrayal of Ahom warrior Bagh Hazarika in the Battle of Saraighat alongside Lachit Barphukan.

Bengaluru woman out on walk mauled by pet dog; gets 50 stitches on face, neck, legsThe pet dog at a neighbour's house attacked the woman who was returning from a morning walk in Bengaluru. A bystander, who tried to intervene and rescue the woman, was also bitten during the attack.

Laid off at 40, boreout at 22: Inside 2026's job crisisAt 40, you're "overqualified," and quietly laid off. At 22, you're "lucky to be here," and slowly bored out. Welcome to 2026's job market: not a crash, but a split reality.

Astounding Alcaraz downs spirited Zverev in marathon, a win away from Career SlamAustralian Open: Carlos Alcaraz has stormed into the men's singles final after beating Alexander Zverev in a semi-final that lasted five hours and 27 minutes at the Rod Laver Arena. In the final, Alcaraz will face the winner of the clash between Jannik Sinner and 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic.

Kerala businessman CJ Roy, Confident Group chief, shoots himself after tax raidsCJ Roy, founder and chairman of Confident Group, was found dead in Bengaluru following Income Tax raids on his company's offices. Police suspect suicide and have registered a case.

US woman charged Rs 18,000 for 400m ride in Mumbai, taxi driver arrestedMumbai Police arrested a taxi driver after a US woman alleged she was charged Rs 18,000 for a 400-metre ride near Mumbai airport, an incident she flagged online.

Bacteria in Bengaluru soil may help build space bricks, finds Astro ShuxThe research, led by scientists at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), has been published in the peer-reviewed journal PLOS One.

When Ajit Pawar's swap deal helped uncle Sharad remain Defence MinisterIn 1991, when PM PV Narasimha Rao named Sharad Pawar the Defence Minister after Congress's election victory, it was Ajit Pawar, a first-time MP, who gave up his Baramati Lok Sabha seat. The move allowed his uncle to contest from Baramati, enter Parliament and continue in the Union Cabinet. But a swap deal was involved too.

Rain and snow likely on Saturday as western disturbance inches closeA powerful Western Disturbance will bring further rain and snow to North India on January 31. Experts predict hailstorms in Rajasthan and dense fog in Uttar Pradesh.

Shashi Tharoor scotches Congress exit talk, praises Rahul Gandhi after meetingA day after meeting Congress's top brass, Shashi Throor reaffirmed his loyalty to the grand old party, saying he will lead the UDF campaign for victory in Kerala Assembly elections.

In the age of equal parenting, why men still struggle to be primary caregivers?Equal parenting is the dream, but it still feels far from reality, with men often limited to occasional diaper duties and short babysitting stints.

NCP leaders meet Devendra Fadnavis, stake claim to Ajit Pawar's portfoliosNCP leaders met Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to stake claim to the key portfolios held by the late Ajit Pawar, seeking to retain them within the party's quota.

Why has Nasa delayed the launch of Artemis-II mission to the Moon?Engineers have monitored cold temperatures and high winds over recent days, determining that weekend conditions would breach launch weather constraints.

Did the Pawars have ties with Israel? The real agricultural storyA viral tweet has revived interest in the Pawar family's long-standing connection with Israel. While not diplomatic, the link traces back to agricultural learning in the 1970s, when Baramati adopted water-efficient farming ideas inspired by Israeli practices, thanks to late Padmashree Dr DG 'Appasaheb' Pawar.

Snow leopard's dramatic prey hunt on Himachal's icy cliffs leaves photographer in aweA rare snow leopard hunt near an icy cliff edge in Himachal left a photographer mesmerised, who shared a video of the encounter on social media.

Will Budget 2026 bring income tax relief? What salaried taxpayers can expectAhead of Budget 2026, one question dominates conversations among salaried taxpayers: will income tax relief finally come? Let's have a look.

Launch of Nasa's Artemis-II Moon mission delayed. Here's the new dateNasa has pushed back the Artemis II wet dress rehearsal and launch opportunities due to an Arctic blast in Florida. Engineers are protecting the spacecraft from freezing temperatures before the historic crewed lunar flyby.

UP typist with 17-crore assets in Bihar, Jharkhand under vigilance scanner Searches were carried out by the vigilance department in Bihar's Banka and Bhagalpur districts and in Deoghar district of Jharkhand by three 24-member teams. The operation revealed a vast property portfolio spread across multiple locations.

sports.headline: Australian Open: Zverev criticises Alcaraz's medical time-out after semi-final loss Alexander Zverev criticised officials for allowing Carlos Alcaraz a medical time-out during their Australian Open semi-final. Alcaraz completed a dramatic 6-4, 7-6(5), 6-7(3), 6-7(4), 7-5 victory in five hours and 27 minutes.

Sanju is Sanju, nothing to worry about him: Batting coach backs struggling India star India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak supports Sanju Samson despite his recent poor form in the ongoing New Zealand T20I series. Samson faces pressure to improve quickly ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026 with stiff competition for places.

Ravi Shastri-backed Pro10 Malaysia tournament to be rescheduled The Pro10 Malaysia cricket tournament has been postponed until after the ICC Men's T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka, with the organisers citing logistical challenges as the reason for the rescheduling.

ICC unveil officials for T20 World Cup, Nitin Menon, Javagal Srinath only Indians The ICC has appointed 24 umpires and 6 match referees for the 2026 Men's T20 World Cup group stage. Key officials like Dharmasena and Tucker are set to reach significant milestones during the tournament.

Lessons, not losses: Matt Henry says tough India tour has hardened New Zealand Matt Henry says New Zealand's bruising India tour delivered vital lessons, not damage, as a young bowling attack grew under pressure and gained confidence ahead of the T20 World Cup.

India strongest team in T20 World Cup, need luck to beat them: Phil Salt England batter Philip Salt acknowledges India as the strongest team ahead of T20 World Cup 2026. He praised India's dominating run and praised Abhishek Sharma's batting prowess.

Astounding Alcaraz downs spirited Zverev in marathon, a win away from Career Slam Australian Open: Carlos Alcaraz has stormed into the men's singles final after beating Alexander Zverev in a semi-final that lasted five hours and 27 minutes at the Rod Laver Arena. In the final, Alcaraz will face the winner of the clash between Jannik Sinner and 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic.

Who is Jensi Kanabar? India U14 star scripts history with Australian Open titleJensi Kanabar won the Australian Open Asia-Pacific U14 title after beating Australia's Musemma Cilek 3-6, 6-4, 6-1 in the final. She became the second Indian after Arnav Paparkar to lift the trophy.

Ducks in cricket: There are ten different 'species'. Do you know them all?Abhishek Sharma has now been dismissed for a duck three times in T20Is for India. The sport, however, recognises ten different types of ducks, defined by how and when a batter is dismissed.

Manpreet Singh, 2 others dropped from team due to disciplinary issues: ReportHockey India has excluded veteran Manpreet Singh and two others from the Pro League probables. Sources suggest that this was done due to disciplinary issues during the tour of South Africa.

Virat Kohli's Instagram Account Restored After Overnight Glitch Sparks Panic Among FansOn this Special Report, reporter Sana Farzeem provides details on the restoration of Indian cricketer Virat Kohli's Instagram account. The account, which boasts over 274 million followers, temporarily disappeared overnight, causing a 'complete frenzy and panic' among fans who found the profile unavailable. Farzeem noted that 'it was shocking when we saw last night late at night that his account was disabled' and mentioned that fans even reached out to Anushka Sharma's profile for updates. While the account is now fully restored with all posts and followers intact, the exact cause remains unconfirmed. The programme discusses whether the disappearance was due to a technical glitch, security concerns, or platform guidelines, as no official statement has been released by Meta or Kohli. The report highlights Kohli's massive influence as the most followed Indian on the platform and the relief felt by his global fan base upon the account's return.

India legend PT Usha's husband Srinivasan dies at 67V Srinivasan, husband of IOA President P T Usha, passed away at 67 after collapsing at home. Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his condolences, highlighting the loss to the sporting community.

Quinton de Kock smashes all-time record in strong warning before T20 World CupQuinton de Kock fired a strong warning before the T20 World Cup after he notched a 43-ball century against West Indies, helping South Africa win by seven wickets in Centurion.

Virat Kohli's Instagram Profile Vanishes Overnight Triggering Panic Among FansThis report focuses on the sudden disappearance of Indian cricket star Virat Kohli's Instagram profile, which has left millions of followers concerned. The news presenter notes that a visit to his page currently displays a 'profile isn't available' message, suggesting the link may be broken or the account removed. The speaker highlights the impact of this event, stating, 'this has cricket fans being left scrambling for answers after Virat Kohli seemingly vanished from Instagram overnight.' As the most followed Indian on the platform, the absence of his profile has triggered intense speculation across social media. The report mentions that Kohli has not yet released a statement on any other platform regarding whether this is a technical glitch or a deliberate move. Fans remain on the edge of their seats, closely monitoring the situation for any official updates or the restoration of the account.

AUS Open Live: Djokovic does the unthinkable, beats Sinner in 5-set thrillerAustralian Open Live, Men's Singles semi-final: Novak Djokovic shows why he is the G.O.A.T as he takes down his bogey, Jannik Sinner in a five-set thriller.

Virat Kohli back on Instagram, fans breathe easy and Anushka gets a breakIndia cricketer Virat Kohli's Instagram account became active again after disappearing overnight. Kohli's verified Instagram account, followed by over 270 million users, had suddenly disappeared from the platform on January 30.

After Iceland, Uganda ready to replace Pakistan in T20 World CupT20 World Cup: After Iceland, Uganda has continued to troll Pakistan on the uncertainty over the latter's spot in the competition. Uganda have said that they are packed and ready in case Pakistan decide to pull out of the tournament.

How India's all-format obsession is quietly undermining its Test futureShubman Gill's chaotic all-format calendar shows how modern scheduling is eroding red-ball skills faster than results can hide them. No wonder India's Test cricket is on the decline.

Djokovic faces Jannik Sinner, a familiar problem in pursuit of 11th titleAustralian Open 2026 semifinal: Legendary Novak Djokovic last beat Jannik Sinner in 2023. He now faces a familiar foe once again in the semi-final clash of the tournament. Will an ageing Djokovic be able to fight off an athlete in his prime?

Did Virat Kohli deactivate Instagram account? Fans seek clarity from Anushka SharmaVirat Kohli's Instagram account disappeared on Friday, triggering speculation online as fans flooded Anushka Sharma's comment sections seeking clarity on the cricketer's sudden absence from the platform.

Grace Harris' all-round brilliance, Nadine's four-fer propel RCB into finalRoyal Challengers Bengaluru reached the WPL 2026 final after an eight-wicket victory over UP Warriorz. Grace Harris and Nadine de Klerk's outstanding performances helped RCB storm into their second WPL final.

Don't disturb chetta: Suryakumar Yadav pokes fun at Sanju Samson on Trivandrum returnIND vs NZ: Suryakumar Yadav poked fun at Sanju Samson as the Indian team arrived in Thiruvananthapuram ahead of the final game of the T20I series against New Zealand.

T20 World Cup will get the best out of Maxwell: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting believes Glenn Maxwell can rediscover his form at the T20 World Cup 2026.  Maxwell scored just 76 runs from eight innings in the Big Bash League 2025–26.

Captain Siraj claims four as Hyderabad dominate Chhattisgarh in Ranji TrophyMohammed Siraj led from the front as Hyderabad captain with his four-wicket haul leading the way for Chhattisgarh to be bundled out on the opening day's play.

Saim Ayub shines as Pakistan finally beat Australia in a T20I after 2650 daysPakistan vs Australia, 1st T20I: An all-round performance from Saim Ayub helped Pakistan end a 2,650-day wait for a T20I win over Australia, sealing a 22-run victory at Lahore's Gaddafi Stadium.

Michael Nobbs, Australian hockey great and former India coach, dies after illnessFormer Australian hockey player Michael Nobbs, who coached the Indian men's team at the 2012 London Olympics, has died after a prolonged illness.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
